page.title: 01St Minver _ Amble Block
page.content: Situated approximately 3km south of the cliffs of{North Cornwall}and 3km east of the broad estuary of the River Camel, the land of this fertile block, set in a countryside of mainly {gently sloping}hills and valleys, lies between the 95m contour and just above sea level. Apart from the north west corner of the block, the{drainage} pattern is towards the{River Camel}to the south and towards its tributary the River Amble in the east. Soils are of medium quality and only very small parcels of land remain unreclaimed. Levels of rainfall are surprisingly {low}for Cornwall. The{952mm isohyet} passes close to St Minver village and a rainfall station immediately south of the block, for the years 1941_1970, reported 923mm per annum, with Nov Dec and Jan averaging around 100mm and Apr May and Jun between 50mm and 65mm.
